movie_title: Can climate change cause more disease? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Every year, mosquito-borne diseases kill around three-quarters of a million globally, but could it g

vocabulary.example: The presence of mosquitos in our backyard is unwelcome during summer.
There has been a surge in online shopping during the pandemic.
Viruses need to replicate inside a host cell to multiply.

vocabulary.definition: conditions relating to public health, especially the provision of clean drinking water and adequate sewage disposal
vocabulary.example: Improving sanitation in developing countries is crucial for preventing diseases.

vocabulary.definition: a sudden occurrence of something unwelcome, such as a disease
vocabulary.example: There was an outbreak of flu in the school, leading to many students falling ill.

vocabulary.definition: a substance used to stimulate the production of antibodies and provide immunity against one or several diseases
vocabulary.example: Scientists are working on developing a vaccine for the new virus strain.
